TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SubMenuStyleCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> class as the underlying data type of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> property provides additional style choices in addition to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuStyle%2A> properties. The first style in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection corresponds to the submenu style for the first level of the menu. The second style in the collection corresponds to the submenu style for the second level of the menu, and so on. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> property is most often used to generate a navigation menu, like a Web site map, where menu items at a certain level should have the same appearance, regardless of whether they have submenus.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> class. For more information on the inherited members, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> collection.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> class to specify the style settings for the submenus in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control based on the submenu's level. In this example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[MenuLevelSubMenuStyles#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuLevelSubMenuStyles/CS/menulevelsubmenustylescs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MenuLevelSubMenuStyles#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuLevelSubMenuStyles/VB/menulevelsubmenustylesvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object CreateKnownType(int32 index) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function CreateKnownType (index As Integer) As Object

Docs.param: The index of the data type to create. This parameter is not used in this implementation of the method; therefore, you should always pass in .
Docs.summary: Creates an of the data type that corresponds to the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.CreateKnownType%2A> method is a helper function that is used to create an <xref:System.Object> of the data type that corresponds to the specified index. The index is often determined by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.GetKnownTypes%2A> method to create an array of supported data types and then searching the array for the desired data type.
The `index` parameter is not used in this implementation of the method and is ignored. You should always pass in `null` for this parameter. This implementation of the method always returns an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used only by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Type[] GetKnownTypes() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetKnownTypes () As Type()

Docs.summary: Creates an array of objects that contains the supported data types of the class.
Docs.returns: An array of objects that contains the data types supported by the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.GetKnownTypes%2A> method is a helper function that is used to create an array of data types supported by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> class. The array is often searched to determine the index of a desired data type. The index is then passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.CreateKnownType%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=nameWithType> of the corresponding data type.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used only by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle style);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle style) cil managed
Public Sub Insert (index As Integer, style As SubMenuStyle)

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which the object should be inserted.
The object to insert into the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts a object into the collection at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If index is -1, `style` is inserted at the beginning of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection. If index equals the number of items in the collection, `style` is appended to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.OnValidate%2A> method is called to validate the style parameter before it is added to the collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.OnInsert%2A> method is called before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object is inserted into the collection, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.OnInsertComplete%2A> method is called after the object is inserted.

Docs.exception: The specified is outside the range of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.OnInsert%2A> method is called before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.Add%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.Insert%2A> methods. You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection.OnInsert%2A> method in custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> classes to perform custom processing of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> objects before they are added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle style) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the first occurrence of the specified object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.OnValidate%2A> method is called to validate the style parameter before it is used to locate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object to remove from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.OnRemove%2A> method is called before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object is removed, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.OnRemoveComplete%2A> method is called after the object is removed from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyleCollection> collection.
